alert.note: Alert for Macomb; Oakland; Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 10:23PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rainfall for Wayne, Oakland, Macomb and eastern Washtenaw Counties... At 1020 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with heavy rainfall along a line extending from Romeo to near Wyandotte to near Saline then extending west along the I-96 and I-94 corridors. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall. Wind gusts around 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized street and road flooding. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Thunderstorms will be near... Taylor and Greenfield Village around 1025 PM EDT. Dearborn around 1030 PM EDT. Romeo and Trenton around 1035 PM EDT. Wyandotte around 1045 PM EDT. Downtown Detroit around 1105 PM EDT. Armada around 1110 PM EDT. Willis and Belle Isle around 1125 PM EDT. Richmond and Belleville around 1130 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Franklin, Keego Harbor, Melvindale, Waterford, Shelby Township, Commerce, Ray Center, Utica, Auburn Hills and Lake Angelus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
